1.description: First, create the blade, which will form the sharp, functional edge of the knife, positioned at the forefront of the tool. This foundational part is crucial as it defines the primary purpose of the knife, allowing it to cut effectively while setting the stage for the subsequent components that will enhance its usability and structural integrity.

2.description: Next, attach the handle to the base of the blade, ensuring it is securely fastened to provide a comfortable grip for the user. This connection not only enhances the knife's usability by allowing for better control during cutting tasks but also contributes to the overall balance and stability of the object as it is used.

3.description: Finally, add the fingerhole to the handle, positioned centrally along its length, allowing for a secure grip and enhanced control during use. This addition not only improves usability by accommodating the user's fingers but also reinforces the overall stability of the handle, ensuring a comfortable and efficient interaction with the blade.
